bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names e kou chuang 鵝口瘡 , goose-mouth sores; e kou bai chuang 鵝口白瘡 , white goose-mouth sores. Pathological Condition of chuang 瘡 , sores, with a white layer covering the mucous membranes and top of the tongue in a child’s mouth making it resemble a goose-mouth. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 15: 小兒初生，口裏白屑起，乃至舌上生瘡，如鵝口裏，世謂之鵝 口 , “When in a newborn child a white scaling develops in the mouth eventually generating sores on its tongue so that it looks like the inside of a goose-mouth, this is generally called ‘ goose-mouth ’”.
